column1: overpitched outside off, stands tall, no need for feet. Smashes it through the line straight past the stumps
overpitched on the pads, looks to whip it through the leg side and misses, raps him on the pads
good length at middle stump, waits for it and turns it through square leg
good length, pushed across the angle from the right hander, who tries to chop it but gets a thick inside edge that bounces to the slip cordon
full and on the pads, tries to flick it into the leg side, it sounded like an inside edge but signalled leg byes as it rolls towards deep square
back of a length outside off, goes back and punches towards mid-off, extra cover comes across and puts in a dive
good length outside off, goes with his hands and slices it to backward point
134 kph, back of a length at middle, opens up and slogs it to deep square leg's left
good length outside off, expands his arms and throws his bat at it, he's nowwhere near the pitch but he uses his reach to slice it over point
139 kph, back of a length, angled into the batsman, raps him on the pads but he's the only one appealing, single down towards third man
full at off stump, driven to mid-off's left
good length, angled in at middle and off, opens up to drive but has to fend it last minute into the covers
back of a length in the corridor, uses the angle and slashes it past point, but third man runs across nicely and puts in a dive to his right...but it looks his foot has touched the boundary. Unlucky.
good length at the pads, tries to whip it past short fine, but it catches his pad
slower ball, good length, tossed outside off stump, goes for the slog sweep, inside edge onto pad

back of a length, angled across off, he steps out and tries to swat this out of the country, gets a top edge...and Elliott has dropped it at long leg! Gets under it nicely but chooses to go low on this and floors it

short in the corridor, tries to ramp it over the slip, and it's another dropped catch. Amir miscued it and it went low to third man's left, he too got under it - although it was flatter and quicker than the previous one - and put in a last ditch effort to catch it. Instead, lobs it towards the boundary...replays show that should've been a six.
good length on off, opens the face and turns it down to third man
back of a length and into the batsman, who tries to pull but can't get connection, rolls to fine leg
full at middle, goes forward and hits across the line to flick it to deep square

good length, angled down towards the leg side, but he steps out and cuts the angle down. Wants to slap this for six straight over the bowler, but gets a top edge that flies upwards and behind him where Rizwan spins and spins before holding on to this right
angled full and down the leg side, raps him on the pads
back of a length at off stump, defended into the off side
rolls his fingers on this, good length outside off, expansive drive on the up, straight to covers
good length outside off, gets low and swats it to deep midwicket...that reached the fielder in no time
back of a length outside off, tucks it off the back foot to long-on
good length outside off, comes back into him, punched off the back foot to covers
good length outside off, pushed to deep midwicket
drags the offspinner short outside off, but Haddin has shuffled across and cuts down his room, can only punch it to mid-off
short and wide outside off, pokes at it off the back foot and opens the face, but short third man is square and cuts it off
good length, angled into the pads, and catches him on it once more
good length, angled into him, nonchalant stab at it with no feet, lobs up towards midwicket who takes it on the bounce and has a shy at the non-strikers
good length at middle, turned away uncomfortably to deep square with no feet movement

135 kph, lights up the stumps! Haddin has seen Yamin's angle enough to know how it's going to come at him, and gives him the charge to try and slog it past midwicket, but he gets and inside edge onto the stumps
short and wide outside off, his feet are rooted as he throws his bat at it and gets beaten
back of a length at off stump, defended into the covers
....and goes out of the park first ball! Drops it short outside off, hangs back and slaps it flat over the midwicket fence

he's got his revenge! Hits a good length outside off, drags him forward, sneaks past his inside edge with the straighter one and catches his pads. The keeper pulled out of the appeal but Yasir was convinced and so was the umpire
tossed up at off stump, driven past the bowler who dived over it. Long-off gets work to do
tossed up in the blockhole at middle, tries to turn it into the leg side, inside edge onto the boot
good length at off stump, bunted into the off side off the back foot
slider, drops it short at middle, Misbah tries to power it through the leg side off his back foot, inside edge onto the boot
good length at leg stump, punched towards midwicket
full on the pads, flicked to deep square
tossed up on a good length at middle stump, Duckett doesn't get to the pitch as he slices this to deep cover
back of a length outside off, shapes for the sweep but has to adjust and use an angled bat to poke it to short third
good length outside off, this time he premeditates the reverse sweep - and McCullum spots it and moves to his right at slip. Unfortunately, he's stepped too far across and it flies past his left foot
good length outside off, puts in a big stride and stretches fully to connect the sweep, but gets on top of it too much and can only turn it straight to short fine
good length at off, wants to push it to long-off, hits it back to the bowler
good length outside off, once again, not to the pitch as he uses his wrists to turn it through square leg last minute. Hard hands from Duckett

massive! Exposes his stumps, stands tall, dares the bowler to toss it up - he does. Swings his arms at this and smashes it straight over Yasir and it slams into the roof and falls down into the stands. 95 metres.
full outside off, driven off the front foot to deep cover
good length at leg stump, miscues the reverse sweep and it goes harmlessly to backward point
good length outside off, pushed to cover
good length at off stump, pushes it back to the bowler off the back foot
back of a length, angled across the left-hander from over the wicket, pushed to point
back of a length, angled across, goes for the back foot punch, gets it off the bottom of the bat straight to covers

132 kph, anticipates his angle and walks towards it. A little shimmy outside off and uses his pace to lift him past short fine leg and it looks like it has caught the ropes on the full...third umpire looking at this...and it's given four. That was a little bizzare. Clearly seemed to have caught the rope on the full.
back of a length angled across, goes for the pull, hits the top of the bat and bounces towards midwicket
back of a length in the corridor, punched to sweeper cover
back of a length at middle, steps down, not even close to the pitch as he pushes it to deep square
short and well wide, Misbah had backed away again, but yasir overcompensated
backs way again, punched off the back foot to McCullum who runs 5 yards and puts in a dive
good length outside off, backs away and slaps it over cover using his reach
back of a length on the pad, glanced square off his thigh
back of a length outside off, steps out and pushes it back to the bowler. Duckett is struggling against spin, stepping out every ball
steps out at the good length ball, not to the pitch again, and has to improvise a sweep to deep square
good length, angled into the left-hander and he doesn't connect on the attempted flick and cops it on his body

got him! Good length, pitches outside off and nips back in, but Misbah has followed the line and not the movement. Pokes at it with no feet, gets a healthy inside edge through to the keeper. At least it sounded like, Misbah is not happy at all
good length outside off, pushed on the up to cover
back of a length outside off, punched off the back foot to mid-off

dropped.Goes for the bouncer, he connects his hook nicely from outside off, it's in the air but dipping at deep square leg, where Irfan Jr. puts in a good effort to even go for that, but can't pouch it
...and that effort is followed by a misfield as two fielders converge at this leg glance into the square leg region and both let it go
dropped short at middle, goes back and pulls it to deep midwicket
good length outside off, goes forward and pushes it to sweeper cover
puts him out of his misery. Premeditates a switch hit, exposes all his stumps as he swipes at this full ball on off stump and misses it altogether
short and wide, punches it to sweeper cover off the back foot
good length outside off, punches off the back foot to long-off
short and wide, cuts it straight to backward point
good length at off stump, punhced off the back foot to covers, who puts in a dive and parries it towards the mid-off region
good length outside off, wants to drive this on the up, bat turns and it rolls down to long-off
good length outside off, goes forward and pushes it slightly uppishly towards covers

goes forward and tries to push this across the line into the leg side, catches his front pad and the umpire raises the finger...Watson is not happy either, did he nick that? Nope. Replays show it's plumb. Struck in front of middle and off and hitting middle halfway.
good length, offspinner fired at off stump, front foot defence
good length outside off, forward defence
back of a length outside off, hangs back and uses his wrists to turn it to deep square off the back foot
back of a length at middle, pushed to deep midwicket off the back foot
full and down the leg side, keeper fumbles and they sneak through
back of a length outside off, punched towards deep cover, but extra cover puts in a super dive

dropped. Back of a length outside off, slogs it across the line, the fielder ran to his left and just about mistimed his jump as he missed this at the deep midwicket. The umpire can't get this one wrong, it's six
good length outside off, pushed to covers off the front foot
back of a length, slides it into the pads, flicked behind square. Deep square runs in hard and goes one handed, doesn't get it cleanly and over runs to concede another
back of a length outside off, goes back and slices it to short third man
tossed up on the pads, tries to flick it but sparese connection on this
back of a length at off, opens the face and runs it to short third man
full at middle, punched down to long-on
back of a length at middle, goes back and turns it using his wrists towards long leg
good length outside off, gets nice and low and middles his sweep nicely to bisect deep square and deep midwicket
back of a length outside off, punched off the back foot to sweeper cover's right
back of a length, angled in at the off stump, uses soft hands to drop it into the off side towards point
finds the blockhole at middle stump, jams it out off his toes to deep square
yoker at middle stump, charges at him and drives it to long-off
yorker outside off, has to really reach out at this, but can't get bat on it
sensational bowling. Nails his fourth consecutive yorker. This one is also outside off, and sneaks under the batsman's attempted drive
slower delivery from around the wicket, drops it too short, it sits up for him and he hammers it off the back foot straight over the bowler
short and into the rib cage, just about gets under it and pulls it to deep square leg with little control
goes for the yorker, it falls slightly short, overpitched at middle, angles in and he slogs it - grounded - straight to deep midwicket
back of a length outside off, wants to use the angle to ramp it between keeper and short fine, but just misses out. Tanvir needs to sort out his line and length
and he does. Sort of. Slower ball, good length outside off, gets on one knee to slog sweep, but it's way too slow and he's through with his shot early
yorker at middle stump, thick inside edge on his attempted swat through the leg side, goes straight to short fine who shies and misses
misses his length, it's a full toss, knee-height at middle, shuffles across and lifts it easily over fine leg
geez! Back of a length outside off and he's hit this disdainfully past covers - no feet, stand and deliver on the up
yorker down the leg side, might have been a wide, but catches his pad
yorker outside off, jammed down to long-off

what a shot! This is some talent on display from Shadab. It's overpitched outside off, he's put his back foot two yards back and across, front foot rooted, body crouched right below to contort and get under the ball as he ramps it over short-fine leg. Incredible.
goes for the bouncer and beats his attempted upper cut
overpitched at off, not a great length, but the batsman has discovered that it's a slower ball. Bat swing is through too early, it catches the bottom and balloons to McCullum at mid-off
slower ball, full outside off, slices off the outside edge to third man
full slower ball outside off, slices it to third man after shaping up to slog
bouncer at his chest, gets tangled up and in the end only manages to lift it over point
full toss on the pads, midwicket is in, Shadab only has to get it past him, and does
length ball at middle, but doesn't connect the pull shot. It goes to long-on, Sami comes back for a sacrifical second, but the throw has gone to the other end where the keeper whips the bails off
full outside off, smashed aerially past mid-off's right
short ball in the corridor, goes for a full-blooded pull, is beaten

back of a length outside off, wants to swat this through mid-off with a horizontal bat, toe-ends it back to the bowler, takes off for a run instinctively, and has to dive to get back. No direct hit, thankfully
good length on the pads, whipped away to short fine
bowls him a bouncer first up, he sways backwards and almost loses his footing as he ducks

did he mean to get runs like this? Gives him the charge, gets followed with a bouncer down the leg side, ducks under it and the keeper can't possible get to that. He didn't even attempt to....and he's overstepped too, it will be a free hit
full outside off, gets it to swing away slightly, but McCullum has cleared his front foot and sliced it over point
good length on the pads, shapes slightly away, goes for the flick and catches it on the pads
gives him the charge again, followed once again, but this time the direction is right - straight at his ribs and he can't chop it to third man after tying himself up
gets a nice one on the pads, wants to work it fine, but can't connect
backs away again, gets followed and tied up, he can only push it to point
short and angled into the batsman, goes for the pull but no connection and it trickles down to short fine
good length outside off, tries to drive on the up, thick inside edge to short fine's right
back of a length outside off, goes back and tries to flay it through the off side, beaten on the outside edge
back of a length, angled into him, cramps him for room as he gives the charge, but he goes through with the pull. Catches it with the bottom but gets it past Watson at midwicket
full outside off, gets in position for this but crunches it straight to mid-off
angles a bouncer at his neck, he goes for the hook and misses
good length at off stump, punched on the up to mid-off
back of a length at middle, punches it off the back foot to mid-on's left
gets the bottom of the bat and it bounces back to the bowler
back of a length outside off, swats across the line and is beaten
back of a length at middle, tries to whip it through the leg side again, inside edge onto the thigh guard and it lands near the crease
backs away, gets it good length, angled into him and bunts it back to the bowler
full and angled into the pads, driven to mid-on, bit of a collision with the bowler as he runs and he would've been well out with a direct hit
short at middle, sits up nicely and he pulls it hard, but only slightly to deep square's leg
back of a length on the hips, whips it with the angle behind square, Smith moves nimbly to his left at deep square and just manages to keep it in

back of a length on the hips, swivels as he attempts a pull, gets glove on it and it floats towards short fine who takes it on the bounce and uses his momentum moving right to do a 360 and shy at the stumps
bouncer in the corridor, takes his eyes off the ball on his attempted hook, a feeble response to that bouncer and it takes the top edge and goes straight to Shadab at point
back of a length outside off, pushes it to point off the front foot
back of a length, pitches outside leg, sits in the pitch and climbs on him. Gets squared up and defends with some respect
full at leg stump, backs away to try and bludgeon it through the leg side, but it's a thick inside edge to midwicket
back of a length outside off, absolutely creams a pull shot, but straight to deep square
back of a length slower ball in the corridor, sneaks under his attempted slog

slower ball, full outside off, tries to hit this hard, connects it nicely but straight to Misbah at mid-off. He picked the slower ball and waited, slowly getting his front foot out of the way to enable a nice bat swing. But there was no attempt at placement
back of a length, angled across off stump, goes for the cut, under-edged to the keeper
tossed up at middle stump, pushed down to long-on
drops it short outside off, has enough time to go on the back foot and turn it into the leg side
superb ball. A googly, pitched at a good length on middle stump, draws him forward, takes the outside edge and in another format, it would've been the perfect legspinner's wicket

back of a length at middle, spins back in and beats his premeditated reverse sweep. Hits him on the thigh in front of leg stump. Close call that, the height was questionable, but the umpire believes this is out...replays show it would've been umpire's call on review, so good decision. Zaman saw a slip in place after the previous ball and wanted to force the issue. Not a good shot.
pushes a faster one in at a good length outside off, hurries him on the cut shot and he hits it straight to short third man
beats his cut outside off with another slider
good length at middle stump, walks across his stumps and just manages to get bat on his glance across the line. Would've been dead in front if he hadn't managed to get bat on that
back of a length at middle stump, pushed off the back foot to midwicket. Offers the full face this time.
back of a length, cramps him in the corridor but he gets right back and slices it to third man
good length at middle, fended off the front foot into the off side
walks across his stumps, pushes this good length ball square
good length at off stump, defended off the front foot
back of a length at off stump, goes back and drags it towards deep midwicket
dropped short at middle, pulled to deep midwicket
good length at leg stump, wrong'un, tries to turn it into the leg side, raps him on the pads
back of a length and spinning away from outside off, past the outside edge on his attempted cut
another googly. Good length outside off, catches the inside edge on his forward prod and it rolls away to midwicket
gives him the charge, doesn't get to the pitch, but goes through with the inside-out shot and gets just enough to lift it over cover
back of a length at middle, cramps him as he tries to turn it into the leg side, pushes it back to the bowler
good length at off stump, should've gone forward, is rooted to the crease, but there's some indication that the pitch is true. Punched to long-on comfortably
full and drifted onto the pads, leans forward and flicks it nicely, in the air, between fine leg and deep square
back of a length at middle, glanced to deep square leg
good length outside off, driven on the up, straight to cover

full at off stump, gives him the charge and yorks himself. Tries to whip it across the line but he's completely missed this. Awful shot. Off stump is all over the place and Lahore have a big task now.
back of a length outside off, defended off the back foot
back of a length outside off, hangs back and offers what Boycott would call and uncultured slog at it. But gets enough bat to turn it to fine leg's left
oooooooh! Sweet! Good length outside off, lifts it through the line, on the up straight over mid-off

back of a length on the hips and....oh dear. What happened there? Big man Irfan has gone down to field it, all right, but the ball has already deflected off his large levers before he can and run away for four
back of a length outside off, dabs it into the off side with soft hands
back of a length at off stump, sliced to backward point
back of a length at middle stump, shapes up to slog it but misses out. Inside edge onto pad and back to the bowler

slower ball outside off, tries to jam it out to the off side, jams it into the ground and it bounces up. Watson is quickly across, swivels quickly, releases it even more quickly and breaks the stumps at the non-strikers as Irfan plonks his bat lazily...it's been reviewed. And it's out! Quick quick quick, from Watson, even if his bowling isn't so these days. He's got it in the field.
good length at middle, clears the front foot and tries to slog this as well, just about gets an inside edge before it catches his back foot in front of the stumps
full outside off, arches to the right as he squats and places it between short third man and point

back of a length at middle, pulled out to depe midwicket, who puts in a nice throw but a bad bounce takes it awakwardly upwards from Watson who is at the stumps. Would've been close it if he could've grasped that, there was a mix up
good length, angled into the pads, lifts it with the angle over the long leg boundary
good length outside off, gives him the charge and doesn't get to the pitch. Has to use his hands to push at it as it turns away slightly
back of a length outside off, chopped straight to backward point
short and wide, one hands comes off the bat as he cuts this to backward point
back of a length outside off, hurries him as he goes back and he pushes it to cover
googly, spins in from back of a length outside off, punched off the back foot to deep midwicket
back of a length outside off, dabbed to short third man
back of a length, angled away from outside off, tries to push it off the back foot to third man, but it's a slower ball that sits in the pitch and climbs past the outside edge
bouncer angled high and wide away from the batsman, but he gets his bat up and uses a lot of effort to pull this into the lg side for a single
short and at middle stump, pulled to deep midwicket
full at off stump, steps down the track, meets it on the full and drives it mid-off. Gets across quickly to compete the run
slower ball, good length outside off, punched past the non-striker to mid-off's right

full and wide, throws his hands at it and slices it over point, goes high and well past Duckett's dramatic dive at the boundary - he was nowhere near it. Akmal has his helmet off as he acknowledges his fifty. This means a great deal to him
back of a length outside off, follows the batsman who shuffles across and runs it down to third man
good length outside off, tries to chop it past point, no feet, gets beaten
short and wide, cut away regally past a diving point's right
good length outside off, pushed off the front foot to deep cover
good length at the pads, tries to whip it over midwicket, gets an inside edge onto pad and it flies harmlessly towards long-on
back of a length outside off, tries to turn it into the leg side, hits it back to the bowler
full at middle stump, punched to long-on
yorker at middle stump, walks across the stumps and turns it behind square where the deep fielder has to run a few yards to his right
yorker at off stump, dug out to point
yorker at off stump, pushed off the front foot towards mid-off
overpitched on the pads, flicks it nonchalantly, one bounce, four at the square leg boundary
drops it short at middle, pulled to deep square
short and wide, goes for the cut, just beats him on the outside edge

he's got him! What a day this guy is having! Akmal has played across on one too many deliveries. and this faster googly has caught him in front of the stumps as he tries to whip it into the leg side and Shadab knew the moment he missed that he's got his man. Off on a mini-Tahir run. Islamabad straight back into it.
short outside off, Narine goes back and is looking over the midwicket boundary to see if his pull connected, but it's in the keeper's hands
oooooooo! Full, on the pads, stays in the crease, minimal movement and lifts it over square! That was huge!
and again! This one is classy! Back of a length outside off, hangs back in the crease and pulls it over midwicket
good length outside off, swings at it again, but it's a googly and spins past the bat
overpitched at leg stump, clears the front foot and slogs it past midwicket
length ball outside off, slapped hard to deep point, where Duckett puts in a slide but takes too long to get back up and get in a throw. They come back for two
superb bouncer, directed at a middle stump line and he wasn't close to connecting that hook shot
another great bouncer, similar line, similar height, but it's burst straight through Haddin's gloves. Tips it over the bar, which means punishment in this game
length ball, tries to club it through midwicket, but gets an inside edge onto the boot
back of a length outside leg, horrible line considering square leg has just come in. Luckily, he miscues the pull and it floats past the square leg fielder and deep midwicket comes across

in the blockhole...and out! It was tailing in viciously and struck him on leg stump, but you've gotta reckon that was going down the leg side. We'll wait for the replays, but this looks like another howler...yep. Snicko shows disturbance too.
in the blockhole at leg stump again, Tanvir has held his shape and whipped it to deep midwicket
short at middle, shuffles ever so slightly and nails the pull shot to deep square leg's right
slower ball, full outside off, picks it, waits for it, and carves it out to sweeper cover
slower bouncer in the corridor, through the hook too early, beaten
slower ball, full at middle, he gets under it and whips it. It looks a gorgeous shot, but there's only height on it. Hardly any distance. Deep square leg runs in and takes an easy catch

would you believe this?! Gets one on his hips, tries to whip it over square leg off the back foot. That's now what he should've been doing. It bobbles up and square leg takes it easily...have they crossed over? Looks like it

he knows only one way to do it! What a shot! Length ball at off stump, goes deep in his crease and launches it over long-on to end all this drama. Poor ball in the circumstances, but what a finish from this guy. Watches it sail over and drops the bat like the metaphorical mic
